Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <passcombo> regarding identity in Verus whipepaper, I quickly jumped through, not sure if I can see there a place for profiles or (any) institutions doing profile verifications in a more open way. What I expect by identity is actually an identity that changes in time, and has time-based properties. Meaning: if someone from the network meet with me in person and confirms my profile photo matches my name and second name with my gov id - it will be differently weight in markin profile as true based on if that happen yesterday or 10 years ago. For example each profile check or even profile check type could have a life time, also specific properties could have a lifetime, and scale linearly to weight 0 at end of life. Also if someone confirms pgoto + name without id it will be differently weight. This way anyone can confirm anyone. Confirmation should send some points based on confirming profile rank. This way in time some institutions or profiles will come up which will charge fees for professional confirmations, and they will have big trust. HEre a penalty must be introduced - if someone cheated/mistaked. So profiles should have many properties regarding confirming profiles itself. This way everyone could be confirmed with his friends on facebook (for example) but much stronger in gov office or in some company doing such service, or even in a bank.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <passcombo> Quite a lot of work, part of which will be needed still after implementation and monitoring the system in the wild (to weight in penalties to recognize profile cheaters).

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <hastrup> so the komodo agamawallet is no good?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <passcombo> Great if penalties could propagate live, so when a "cheater" is detected (by kind of error-rate?) by system (network = conflicting profile marks in narrows space-time) all previous profile confirmations should be some way cancelled or weight zero? just guessing should work some way like that, but calibration may be hell üòÉ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> @samson People had the wool pulled over their eyes during the 2000 elections.  The notion that a paperless voting system that is NOT 100% verifiable (as a blockchain would be) would be superior to paper is simply wrongheaded.  With paper there IS a record.  With the current system?  Who really knows.

Was the 2000 election a false flag?  Probably not.  But the result would be the same.  A non-verifiable electronic election is subject to all kinds of deception and frankly, it is just a matter of time before such a system is captured and used to keep one party in power indefinitely.  Just like 'digital books', electronic data can be edited on the fly.  Ie., what Wikipedia said in 2015 might bear little in resemblance to the same entry in 2020.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <wistar> Observation: Win 10 Agama GUI v11. Only my i9 machines get out of sync. Even if I run them slower than my Ryzen 1700s and i7s. Another thing: I can't stop the i9s from mining using the STOP button. _Whether or not the i9 machines are synced_, if I click the STOP button, it will briefly show a grayed-out LOADING button state and then the button-state just goes back to STOP and the machine continues mining & staking. Even if I go to the Verus badge on the left side of the interface and click the three-dot menu and select _STOP_, nothing happens‚Äîit just continues to mine. The only way to stop it is to X out of Agama.

This is not true on any machine other than my i9s. I am beginning to wonder if there isn't a bug specific to machines with greater than 8 physical cores.
